39833e34-d879-4381-8c96-e327f7702c5a.description: To earn this badge, participants successfully complete the Inclusive Leadership program designed for the Greater Toronto Airport Authority. Focused on targeted elements of diversity, equity, and inclusion, this interactive learning journey builds both relational skills and strategic capabilities. The program equips GTAA Inclusive Leaders to create a work culture of inclusion and belonging that anchors and supports a smart, healthy and profitable airport environment.
39833e34-d879-4381-8c96-e327f7702c5a.name: Inclusive Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners engage in 12 hours of highly interactive learning, incorporating individual reflection, small group collaboration, discussions, guided role plays, and scenario-based skill practice. Self-paced “bridge work” is completed between live sessions, as well as “calls to action,” where they apply key learnings with their team. The program culminates in a capstone event, where participants present collaborative solutions to specific DEI-related challenges within the organization.

78098ce0-4b75-46d6-8eb1-7c1cc78fab3a.description: To earn this badge participants must have completed all 12 hours of the Moderna Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt Certificate course as well as successfully passing the CEG Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt certificate exam. Recipients of this badge will be valuable assets in helping driving an organization's goals and future objectives through improved efficiency and process improvement.
78098ce0-4b75-46d6-8eb1-7c1cc78fab3a.name: Moderna Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Throughout the course participants learn tools and techniques to reduce defects, streamline processes and improve product quality. This is achieved by understanding and applying the DMAIC approach as a Lean Six Sigma project team member.

skills.name: Monitoring and controlling process improvement solutions

d8ace276-d33b-41a2-b5c1-ca51b5cbb39b.description: To earn this badge participants must have completed all 63 hours of the Corporate Education Group' Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certificate course as well as successfully passing the CEG certificate exam and completing a relevant team project within 12 months of the class end-date. Recipients of this badge will be valuable assets in helping driving an organization's goals and future objectives through improved efficiency and process improvement as a Lean Six Sigma core team member.
d8ace276-d33b-41a2-b5c1-ca51b5cbb39b.name: MBTA - Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Throughout the course participants learn tools and techniques to reduce defects, streamline process and improve product quality. This is achieved by understanding and applying the DMAIC approach as a Lean Six Sigma project team member.

skills.name: Define Measure Analyze Improve And Control (DMAIC)
Monitoring and controlling process improvement solutions

02942f50-b581-4aaa-9b4a-433e405322b1.description: To receive this badge, participants will need to have completed all 12 hours of learning over the four live, virtual sessions, including two assessments. The certificate program covers the following topics: Effective Communication; Establishing Your Brand; Being a Valued Team Member; Building Your Career.
02942f50-b581-4aaa-9b4a-433e405322b1.name: Lumentum The Aspire Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners engage in 12 hours of live virtual sessions, along with three self-paced “Bridge” learning assignments and two 60-minute 1-1 Coaching Sessions. Prior to the live, virtual sessions the "DiSC" Assessment is completed. After the sessions the "CliftonStrengths Finder" assessment is completed. All of which takes place over 4 weeks.

183fc894-f2e9-4d74-bc42-ed6ad6d96534.description: To earn this badge participants must successfully complete all 16 hours of learning of the "Emerging Leaders Certificate Program" as well as a pre-program assessment, two self-paced "Bridge" learning assignments and a 30-minute 1-1 coaching session.
183fc894-f2e9-4d74-bc42-ed6ad6d96534.name: Emerging Leaders Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners engage in 16 hours of live virtual sessions spread over three weeks. Throughout this experiential learning journey participants explore various dimensions of leadership with a focus on building strong relationships and delivering results. Topics covered include: intentional communication; active listening; enhancing self-awareness; coaching and developing others; and building trust and connection.

0c4c9cac-c8cf-468d-9d70-a78f0d5dc617.description: To earn this badge participants must have successfully completed all 70 hours of Corporate Education Group's "Business Analysis Certificate Program". Recipients of this badge bring value by enabling change in an enterprise by defining needs and recommending solutions that deliver value to stakeholders. They fully understand the role and competencies of the Business Analyst as defined by the IIBA® BABOK® Guide version 3.0.
0c4c9cac-c8cf-468d-9d70-a78f0d5dc617.name: Fidelity Business Analysis Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Throughout the instructor-led, interactive course, participants learn about modeling and documenting project requirements; collaborating with stakeholders to elicit requirements; and planning, managing and communicating requirements. Learning takes place through the application of practical techniques while following a case study through the adaptive requirements life cycle.

c7134d52-d95f-4ffe-bc98-62521ba138c3.description: To earn this badge, participants successfully complete all 16 hours of the Inclusive Leadership Learning Journey. This program covers: Building Leadership Agility; Embracing Diversity, Equity and Inclusion; 5G Connection: Helping a Multigenerational Workforce Thrive; Leveraging Diverse Thinking to Drive Innovation; and Cultivating and Integrating a Hybrid Team.
c7134d52-d95f-4ffe-bc98-62521ba138c3.name: Inclusive Leadership Learning Journey

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners engage in 16 hours of highly interactive learning, incorporating individual reflection, small group collaboration, discussions, guided role plays, and scenario-based skill practice. Two Self-paced “Bridge" learning assignments are completed between live sessions, as well as a 1-1 individual coaching "Launch" session at the end of the program. There is also a Pre-Program Assessment completed by participants.

a9b4179e-b021-4b90-8637-62c81ae24de0.description: To earn this badge participants must have completed all 12 hours of the Health & Wellness Partners Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt Certificate course, as well as successfully passing the CEG Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt certificate exam. Recipients of this badge will be valuable assets in helping drive an organization's goals and future objectives through improved efficiency and process improvement.
a9b4179e-b021-4b90-8637-62c81ae24de0.name: Health and Wellness Partners - Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Throughout the course participants learn tools and techniques to reduce defects, streamline process and improve product quality. This is achieved by understanding and applying the DMAIC approach as a Lean Six Sigma project team member.

skills.name: Monitoring and controlling process improvement solutions

b3b0b039-b67d-43d9-93ec-c30dc5e4ba49.description: To earn this badge recipients must successfully complete all five sessions of Aurora's "Emerging Leaders Certificate Program". This program covers the following topics: Defining the Leader in You; Hiring and Developing Peak Performers; Next Level Leadership; High Performing and Engaged Teams; and Customer Centricity.
b3b0b039-b67d-43d9-93ec-c30dc5e4ba49.name: Aurora Emerging Leaders Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners engage in 35 hours of live virtual sessions along with self-paced "Bridge" learning assignments. Earners also participate in a one-hour, post-classroom, group coaching session as well as completing a personal DiSC assessment. All of which takes place over 5 - 6 weeks.

4da5310c-5c3c-40a2-90eb-46bbd578e936.description: To earn this badge participants successfully complete all five sessions of the “Emerging Leaders Certificate Program”. This program covers the following topics: Defining the Leader in YOU; Solving Business Challenges; The Arc and Art of Feedback; High Performing, Engaged Teams; and Evolving Your Business with Creativity and Innovation.
4da5310c-5c3c-40a2-90eb-46bbd578e936.name: Lumentum Emerging Leaders Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners engage in 30 hours of live virtual sessions, along with four self-paced “Bridge” learning assignments and two 60-minute 1-1 Coaching Sessions and the DiSC Assessment. All of which takes place over 10 weeks.

23d0a9ee-b451-4981-98b1-200405879f59.description: To earn this badge, participants successfully complete all three sessions of the “Tackling Bias and Creating Inclusion Learning Journey” program. Focused on targeted elements of bias and belonging; dimensions of diversity; and building a culture of inclusion, this interactive learning journey builds both relational skills and strategic capabilities.
23d0a9ee-b451-4981-98b1-200405879f59.name: Tackling Bias and Creating Inclusion Learning Journey

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners engage in 6 hours of highly interactive learning, incorporating individual reflection, small group collaboration, whole group discussions, guided role-plays and scenario-based skills practice. Self-paced “bridge work” is completed between the live, virtual sessions to help reinforce learning from the previous session and prepare for the next.

7143e137-0ee0-4103-a228-003969048b10.description: To earn this badge, participants must have successfully completed all 18 hours of Corporate Education Group’s “Business Analysis Foundation Certification” course. Recipients of this badge bring value by enabling change in an enterprise by defining needs and recommending solutions that deliver value to stakeholders. They fully understand the role and competencies of the Business Analyst as defined by the IIBA® BABOK® Guide version 3.0.
7143e137-0ee0-4103-a228-003969048b10.name: Business Analysis Foundation Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Throughout the instructor-led, interactive course, participants learn about Requirements Planning and Scoping, as well as Eliciting Documenting Requirements. Learning takes place through the application of practical techniques while following a case study through the adaptive requirements life cycle process.

7bf3dee4-cb42-4269-bbe6-666368f18698.description: To earn this badge participants must have successfully completed all 30 hours of Corporate Education Group's "Business Process Management Certification" program and successfully passed the end of course exam. Recipients of this badge bring value by enabling change in an enterprise by applying a structured approach to Business Process Management activities. They fully understand and recognize the scope of the five phases of BPM found in the BPM Common Body of Knowledge (BPM CBOK®).
7bf3dee4-cb42-4269-bbe6-666368f18698.name: GPO - Business Process Management Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Throughout the instructor-led, interactive course, participants learn about the BPM Life Cycle Framework and the five phases of BPM - Strategy - Design - Planning - Execution - Measurement. Learning takes place through the application of practical techniques based on industry best practices developed by the ABPMP (Association of BPM Professionals) and provides comprehensive training for those individuals who need to manage business processes within their enterprise.

e8ecba7a-1421-44bb-a01f-550dce0bb440.description: To earn this badge participants successfully complete all five sessions of the “Influential Leadership Certificate Program”. This program covers the following topics: Executive Presence; Leading Change Initiatives; Critical Thinking; Next Level Leadership; and Developing and Executing Strategy.
e8ecba7a-1421-44bb-a01f-550dce0bb440.name: Lumentum Influential Leadership Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners engage in 30 hours of live virtual sessions, along with four self-paced “Bridge” learning assignments and two 60-minute 1-1 Coaching Sessions and the DiSC Assessment. All of which takes place over 6 weeks.

64920d56-0649-4e8b-a171-4347e38ce958.description: To earn this badge participants must successfully complete all seven sessions of the "Women in Leadership Certificate Program" and two individual coaching sessions. This program covers the following topics: Intentional Communication; Lead Like a Girl; EI in the Age of AI: Empathy and Connection; Diversity, Equity and Inclusion; The Art of Managing Up; Leadership Presence; and Linked Development: Applying a Strengths-based Approach to Career Development.
64920d56-0649-4e8b-a171-4347e38ce958.name: Lumentum Women in Leadership Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners engage in 21.5 hours of live-virtual sessions, along with two 45-minute, one-on-one coaching sessions, and the Everything DiSC® Workplace Assessment.

be5a12a2-fc5a-4064-ae3d-63a196632057.description: To earn this badge participants must successfully complete all six instructor-led sessions. This program covers the following topics: Intentional Communications; Lead "Like a Girl"; EI in the Age of AI: Empathy and Connection; The Art of Managing Up; and Leadership Presence.
be5a12a2-fc5a-4064-ae3d-63a196632057.name: Women in Leadership Learning Journey

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners engage in 18.5 hours of live-virtual sessions as well as completing the "Everything Workplace DiSC® (Wiley) assessment. During the learning journey participants will complete three, self-paced "Bridge" learning assignments to help reinforce individual learning. They will also have the opportunity to participate in two, 30 minute, 1-1 coaching sessions.
